com.incors.plaf.alloy.themes
Class CustomFontTheme

  |

All Implemented Interfaces:
AlloyFontTheme
public class CustomFontTheme
extends java.lang.Object
implements AlloyFontTheme

Font theme that allows easy customization of the fonts used by the Alloy Look&Feel.

Constructor Detail

CustomFontTheme

public CustomFontTheme(java.lang.String[] fontNames,
                       int standardFontSize,
                       int smallFontSize)
Creates a new instance of CustomFontTheme. The theme tries to find one of the proposed fonts on the system by checking for each font in the array of proposed fonts if it is available on the system. The first font that is found will be used. If none of the proposed fonts can be found, the system font "Dialog" will be used.

Usage example: CustomTheme myCustomTheme = new CustomTheme(new String[]{"Tahoma", "Verdana", "Helvetica"}, 12, 10);

For more information on how to use font themes with the Alloy Look&Feel, please refer to the AlloyFontTheme-API.
